content: single_crochet as joining 3 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet 2 single_crochet 9 4 2 single_crochet in same single_crochet as joining 4 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet 3 single_crochet 11 5 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 11 6 work even 11 7 work even 11 8 work even 11 9 work even 11 10 work even slip_stitch to join and bind off leaving an 8 long tail so 11 you can sew each ear on to the head later on cat ears make 2 with these ears you are increasing on the edges think triangle the ears will not be stuffed but they will be flat and stand up on the cat s head row instruction stitches 1 chain 2 5 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 5 2 2 single_crochet in same single_crochet as joining 2 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet 1 single_crochet 7 3 2 single_crochet in same single_crochet as joining 3 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet 2 single_crochet 9 4 2 single_crochet in same single_crochet as joining 4 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet 3 single_crochet 11 5 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 11 page 5 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com dog ears make 2 row instruction stitches 1 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 6 2 *2 single_crochet in each single_crochet* around 12 3 *single_crochet in next 1 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 18 4 single_crochet in each single_crochet around increasing 2 stitches evenly in the round 20 5 *single_crochet in next 1 single_crochet decrease over next 2 single_crochet* around single_crochet in last 2 14 6 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 14 7 single_crochet in each single_crochet around decreasing 2 stitches evenly in the round 12 8 work even 12 9 repeat row 7 10 10 work even 10 11 repeat row 7 8 12 work even 8 13 work even 8 14 work even 8 15 work even 8 slip_stitch to join and bind off leaving an 8 long tail so you can sew the ears to the head later on **do not stuff the ears they will lay flat and will flop over and hang down monkey s face the monkey s face is the only piece not worked entirely in the round you are going to chain 1 and turn in the 4th row so in the 5th row you are working on the back or wrong side of this piece you will also use your alternate color for this piece row instruction stitches 1 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 6 2 *2 single_crochet in every single_crochet* around 12 3 *single_crochet in next 1 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 18 4 single_crochet same single_crochet as joining and in next 5 single_crochet increase single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet increase single_crochet in 18 next 6 single_crochet chain 1 turn **you should be 2 stitches before where
